config.question: Who served as secretary of commerce in President Harding’s business-friendly administration and later became president of the United States in 1928?

answer_3.response: The Republicans used their return to power after World War I to halt further reform legislation and establish a friendly relationship between government and business. President Harding made some good cabinet choices, notably Charles Evans Hughes as secretary of state and Herbert C. Hoover as secretary of commerce.
